episode_title: 218 - The One Where Dr. Remoray Dies
note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Everyone except Ross is there watching Days of Our Lives.]

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: Oh Drake.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: I’m sorry Amber. It’s just like Brad to have to have the last word.
[Ross enters]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry I’m late, what happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We, we just wanna see the end.

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: I want you Drake.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: I know you do but you and I can never be together that way.

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: There’s something I never told you Amber. I’m actually your half-brother.
[Everyone gasps. The show ends.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what happens next?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I get the medical award for separating the siamese twins. Then Amber and I go to Venezuela to meet our other half-brother, Ramone. And that’s where I find the world’s biggest emerald. It’s really big but it’s cursed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God that is good TV.

content.description: Chandler and Eddie’s apartment. Chandler is at the foosball table trying to get Phoebe to play a game with him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebs, play with meeee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. This game is grotesque. Twenty armless guys joined at the waist by a steel bar, forced to play soccer forever. Ahh, hello, human-rights violation.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know Phoebs, don’t feel so bad for ’em. After they’re done playing, I break out the little plastic women and everybody has a pretty good time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t you play with your roommate?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah he’s a, he’s not a big fan of foosball.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh oh, ooh, are we not getting along with the new boy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No he’s, he’s alright, just uh, he spends most of his time in his room.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe that’s because you haven’t taken the time to get to know him. Let’s remedy that, shall we?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We don’t need to remedy that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, it’ll be fun. [throws a tennis ball at Eddie’s bedroom door]

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: What was that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, um, I just thought that it would be fun if the three of us had some beers and got to know each other.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Yeah alright, that sounds alright.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good, ok. Oh nooo, I have to go because I’m late for my um, Green Eggs and Ham discussion group. Um tonight it’s why he would not eat them on a train. Have fun bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was so lame.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, yeah. Ok, talk to him. [leaves]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you uh, you think that Speed Racer guy gets a lot of tickets er?

content.description: Chandler and Eddie’s apartment. Chandler and Eddie are talking.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: That’s good, that’s good. So, so, so who broke up with who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’re you kidding? I broke up with her. She actually thought that Sean Penn was the capital of Cambodia.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: That’s good man, when everybody knows that the uh, the capital of Cambodia is uh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it’s not Sean Penn.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Not Sean Penn. Alright, I, I’ve got a funny one, alright. My last girlfriend Tilly. Ok, we’re eating breakfast, right, and I made all these pancakes, there was like 50 pancakes right. And all of the sudden she turns to me, alright, and she says, ‘Eddie.’ I say, ‘yeah,’ she says, ‘Eddie, I don’t want to see you anymore.’ And it was literally like she had reached into my chest, ripped out my heart, and smeared it all over my life, ya know. And now there’s like this incredible abyss, ya know, and I’m falling and I keep falling and I don’t think I’m ever gonna stop. [finishes laughing] That uh, wasn’t such a funny story, was it?

content.description: Central Perk. Phoebe is singing. Monica, Richard, Ross, and Rachel are listening.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And a crusty old man said I’ll do what I can and the rest of the rats played moroccas. That’s it, thanks, good night.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Phoebe’s got another job, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great set tonight Phoebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we should probably get going.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Um, we should go too, I got patients at 8 in the moring.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ya know, I was thinking. Ya know how we always stay at your apartment? Well, I thought maybe tonight we’d stay at my place.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t have my jammies.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, maybe you don’t need them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My baby sister, ladies and gentlemen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up, I’m happy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is so nice. Alright I have to make a speech. I just wanna say that of all the guys that Monica has been with, and that is a lot, I like you the best.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, thank you Phoebs. That’s very sweet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hear that? She likes me best, and apparently there’ve been a lot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not a lot, Phoebe’s kidding, Phoebe’s crazy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe’s dead.

content.description: Chandler and Eddie’s apartment. Chandler is there. There’s a knock at the door. He answers it to see a young woman holding a fishtank.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: I’m looking for Eddie Minowick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, he’s not here right now, uh, I’m Chandler, can I take a message, or, or a fishtank?

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, oh, c’mon in.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: I’m Tilly.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: I gather by that oh that he told you about me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, your uh, name came up in a uh, conversation that terrified me to my very soul.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: He’s kind of intense huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Hey, can I ask you, is Eddie a little…

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: [walks around corner] A little what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bit country? C’mon in here you roomie.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Hello Tilly.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: Eddie, I just came by to drop off your tank.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: That’s very thoughtful of you. It’s very thougtful.

content.speaker: Tilly
content.text: Well, ok then. I’m gonna go. Bye.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Bye-bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye.
[Tilly leaves]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, we gettin’ a fish?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: You had sex with her didn’t you?

content.description: Central Perk. Joey enters with several magazines and runs up to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebs, check it out, check it out, check it out, check it out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ooh, Soap Opera Digest, oh that’s one of my favorite digests.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Page 42, page 42, page 42.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, ok, ok. Ooh, hey ‘new doc on the block, Days of Our Lives’ Joey Tribbiani.’ Ooh, cool picture.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, I look good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey is this true, that you write a lot of your own lines?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, well, kinda yeah. Like, remember last week when Alex was in the accident? Well the line in the script was, ‘If we don’t get this woman to a hospital, she’s going to die.’ But I made it, ‘ If this woman doesn’t get to a hospital, she’s not gonna live.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, ok, I see what you did there. Aren’t you afraid though, that the writers are gonna be kinda mad when they read this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh? Never really thought about the writers. The scripts just kinda come to my house. But you know what? This makes me look good, which makes the show look good, which makes the writers look good so how could they be mad about that?

content.description: At a writer’s desk. The writer is working on a script for Days of Our Lives.

content.speaker: Writer
content.text: Makes up most of his lines. Son-of-a-. Yeah, well, write this jerkweed.

content.description: Joey’s apartment. The next script is being delivered.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I fall down an elevator shaft? What the hell does this mean, I fall down an elevator shaft?

content.speaker: Delivery Guy
content.text: Uhh, I don’t know, I just bring the scripts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They can’t kill me, I’m Francesca’s long lost son.

content.speaker: Delivery Guy
content.text: Right. Could you sign this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No way, I’m not signing that.

content.speaker: Delivery Guy
content.text: I don’t think that’s gonna affect the plot of the show.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How can they do this to me?

content.speaker: Delivery Guy
content.text: Er, uh, I’m just gonna go. Sorry.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica, Richard, Ross, and Rachel are returning.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well it wasn’t that many guys. I mean, if you consider how many guys there actually are, it’s a very small percentage.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, it’s not that big a deal, I was just curious.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: G’night.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Night Richard. Good luck Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, before I tell you, uh, why don’t you tell me how many women you’ve been with.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two? TWO? How is that possible? I mean, have you seen you?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, I mean what can I say? I, I was married to Barbara for 30 years. She was my high school sweetheart, now you, that’s two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two it is. Ok, time for bed, I’m gonna go brush my teeth. [goes in the bathroom]

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Woah, woah, no wait a minute now. C’mon it’s your turn. Oh c’mon. Ya know, I don’t need the actual number, just a ballpark.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, it is definitely less than a ballpark.
[Rachel’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, I am so glad I’m not Monica right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tell me about it. So what, what’s your magic number?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhhhooo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, you know everyone I’ve been with. All, both of them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, there’s you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Better not be doin’ these in order.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, uh, Billy Dreskin, Pete Carney, Barry, and uh, oh, Paolo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yes, the weenie from Torrini.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, are you jealous of Paolo? Oh, c’mon, I’m so much happier with you than I ever was with him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please. That Paolo thing was barely a relationship. All it really was was just, ya know, meaningless animal sex. Ok, ya know, that sounded soooo much better in my head.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eddie, I didn’t sleep with your ex-girlfriend.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: That’s very interesting, ya know, ’cause that’s exactly what someone who slept with her would say.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is nuts. This is crazy. She came over for like two minutes, dropped off a fish tank, and left, end of story.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Where’s Buddy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Buddy?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: My fish, Buddy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There was no fish when she dropped it off.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Oh, this is, this is unbelievable. I mean, first you sleep with my ex-girlfriend then you insult my inteligenct by lying about it and then you kill my fish, my Buddy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey I didn’t kill your fish. Look Eddie…[puts his hand on Eddie’s shoulder] Would you look at what I’m doin’ here. That can’t be smart. So we’re just gonna take this guy right off ya and put him here in Mr. Pocket. Tangellon? [picks up the fruit an tosses it to Eddie, it hits Eddie in the chest and falls]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Richard are in Monica’s bedroom.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That’s it? That’s the giant number you were afraid to tell me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well yeah.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, that’s not bad at all. I mean, you had me thinkin it was like a fleet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You really ok with it?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh honey, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, yay. Ok about that two.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What? Alright, what about my two?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it just seems like a really small number.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Right, and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And, well, don’t you have a lot of wild oats to sew? Or is that what you’re doing with me? Oh my God, am I an oat?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Honey, you are not an oat. I, I mean I don’t know, I, I guess I’m just not an oat guy. I’ve only slept with women I’ve been in love with.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But you’ve only slept with two people.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. Oh wow. You know I love you too, right.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Now I do. [they kiss and fall to the bed]
[Ross and Rachel are in Rachel’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, Ross, please listen to me. Ross, you are so much better for me than Paolo ever was. I mean you care about me, you’re loving, you make me laugh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hey, if I make you laugh, here’s an idea, why don’t you invite Paulo over and have a little romp in the sack and I’ll just stand in the corner and tell knock-knock jokes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, Ross, look, what you and I have is special, all Paolo and I ever had was…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Animal sex, animal sex? So what’re you saying, I mean, you’re saying that like, there’s nothing between us animal at all. I mean there’s not even like, uhm, a little animal, not even, not even like, like chipmunk sex?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Ross, try to hear me. Ok, I, hey, I’m not gonna lie to you. Ok, it was good with Paolo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Knock-knock.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But, what you and I have is so much better. Ok, we have tenderness, we have intimacy, we connect. Ya know, I swear, this is the best I have ever had.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Until now. [jumps on Rachel on the bed]
[later in the bathroom Monica is looking in the drawer, Rachel runs up]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Richard just told me he loves me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, honey that’s great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. I just can’t find…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh they’re in the top drawer. Hurry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You need one too?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooooh yeah.
[they pull out the box of condoms but there’s only one left]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s only one.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Uh, we’ll be right there, we’re just trying to decide something. [shuts the bathroom door]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [comes out of the bedroom] Rachel. [growls then sees Richard standing there] Hey.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey. They’re just trying to decide somehting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good, good, good. So, is uh, was your moustache, did, used to be different?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. How do you uh, ya know, keep it so neat?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I have a little comb.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. And what do you call that?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: A moustache comb.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I, I will do your laundry for one month.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, ok, I will, I will, I, hey, I will clean the apartment for two months.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, I tell you what, I’ll give this to you now if you can tell me where we keep the dustpan.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Agghhh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So were you in Nam?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rock-paper-scissors?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel & Monica
content.text: One two three. [Rachel picks rock, Monica picks scissors]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeesss.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine, go have sex.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No. You have got it completely wrong. John Savage was deerhunter, no legs, John Voit was coming home, couldn’t feel his legs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no way. You’ve got it totally the other way around my friend. John Voit was…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, what oh…[Ross and Rachel go into her room]

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Shall we?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not gonna happen. They’re doing it tonight, we can do it tomorrow.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, in the future, if I could see the schedule beforehand…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. All but Joey are present.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, when I woke up this morning, he’d stolen all the insoles out of my shoes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because he thinks I slept with his ex-girlfriend and killed his fish.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why would you kill his fish?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because sometimes, Phoebe after you sleep with someone, you have to kill the fish.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler honey, I’m sorry. Ok, can we watch Joey’s show now please? [they turn on the TV]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, he’s not here yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, he’s on the show, he knows what happens.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m fine about my problem now, by the way.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh good.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Amber, I want you to know that I’ll always be there for you, as a friend and as your brother.

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: Oh Drake.

content.speaker: Dr. Horton
content.text: Hard day huh? First the medical award, this.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Some guys are just lucky I guess.

content.speaker: Intercom
content.text: Dr. Remore, report to first floor emergency, stat.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Well then, uh, I uhh, guess that’s me. Anyone else need to go on the elevator? Dr. Horton, Dr. Wong?

content.speaker: Dr. Horton
content.text: No, no, they only said you.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Oh, ok. Alright.

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: I love you Drake.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Yeah, whatever. Oh no.

content.speaker: Amber
content.text: Drake, look out.

content.speaker: Dr. Remore
content.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did they just kill off Joey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. [sound of Dr. Remore’s body hitting the bottom of the shaft] Now maybe.

content.description: Joey’s apartment. Everyone is outside knocking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Open up. We want to talk to you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t feel like talkin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh c’mon Joey, we care about you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re worried about you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And some of us really have to pee.
[Joey opens the door]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry Joey [runs to the bathroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen, sorry about your death, that really sucks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We came over as soon as we saw.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How could you not tell us?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, I was kinda hopin’ no one would ever find out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe they can find a way to bring you back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Naa, they said that when they found my body, my brain was so smashed in that the only doctor that could have saved me was me. Supposed to be some kind of irony or somethin.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But Joey, you’re gonna be fine. You don’t need that show, it was just a dumb soap opera.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe, this was the greatest thing that ever happened to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, I was going to incorporate that. Oh good, here’s Monica, she’ll have something nice to say.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, I straightened out your shower curtain so you won’t get mildew. What? To me that’s nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s gonna be ok. You know that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I don’t. It’s like, ya know, you work your whole life for somethin’ and you think that when you get it it’s never gonna be as good as you thought it would be. But this so was. Ya know, it changed everything. Like the other day, I got this credit card application, and I was pre- approved. Huh? I’ve never been pre-approved for anything in my life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, Joey honey, I don’t know if this’ll mean anything to you but you’ll always be pre-approved with us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, that means nothin to me.

content.description: Chandler and Eddie’s apartment.Chandler walks in to see Eddie holding a tray of cookies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhhhaahh.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Pecan sandy, just made em.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah alright. What’re these, raisins?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Uh, sure, why not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [throws it across the room while Eddie’s not looking] Listen Eddie, um, I’ve been thinking about our current living situation and uh, why are you smiling?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: I got a little surprise, look. There’s a new fishie. I named him uh, Chandler, you know, after, after you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [looks in the fish bowl to see a fish cracker] Well that’s not an, even a real fish. No, that’s a goldfish cracker.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: What’s you point man?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, good night. [walks towards his room] You big freak of nature.
[Ross comes out of Rachel’s bedroom in her bathrobe and heads for the bathroom. On his way back, Richard comes out of Monica’s bedroom in her bathrobe.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ohh, brisk tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh man.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Let’s never speak of this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got it.
